method.name: GetAll
method.comment: Retrieve all values from the preferences.

method.name: Edit
method.comment: Create a new Editor for these preferences, through which you can make modifications to the data in the preferences and atomically commit those changes back to the SharedPreferences object.

method.name: UnregisterOnSharedPreferenceChangeListener
method.comment: Unregisters an OnSharedPreferenceChangeListener.

method.name: GetStringSet
method.comment: Retrieve a set of String values from the preferences.

method.name: RegisterOnSharedPreferenceChangeListener
method.comment: Create, registers and returns an OnSharedPreferenceChangeListener. This SharedPreference object will now raise the event: SharedPreferenceChanged(Key As String)

method.name: Initialize
method.comment: Gets a SharedPreferences instance that points to the default file.

method.name: Initialize2
method.comment: Gets a SharedPreferences instance that points to the file specified by Name using the specified Mode.

method.name: Contains
method.comment: Checks whether the preferences contains a preference.

method.name: Apply
method.comment: Commit your preferences changes back from this Editor to the SharedPreferences object it is editing. Unlike Commit(), which writes its preferences out to persistent storage synchronously, Apply() commits its changes to the in-memory SharedPreferences immediately but starts an asynchronous commit to disk and you won't be notified of any failures. If another editor on this SharedPreferences does a regular Commit() while an Apply() is still outstanding, the Commit() will block until all async commits are completed as well as the commit itself.

method.name: PutInt
method.comment: Set an int value in the preferences editor, to be written back once Commit() or Apply() are called.

method.name: PutLong
method.comment: Set a long value in the preferences editor, to be written back once Commit() or Apply() are called.

method.name: Remove
method.comment: Mark in the editor that a preference value should be removed, which will be done in the actual preferences once Commit() or Apply() is called.

method.name: Clear
method.comment: Mark in the editor to remove all values from the preferences.

method.name: PutBoolean
method.comment: Set a boolean value in the preferences editor, to be written back once Commit() or Apply() are called.

method.name: Commit
method.comment: Commit your preferences changes back from this Editor to the SharedPreferences object it is editing. If you don't care about the return value, consider using Apply() instead. Returns True if the new values were successfully written to persistent storage.

method.name: PutStringSet
method.comment: Set an array of String values in the preferences editor, to be written back once Commit() or Apply() is called.

method.name: PutString
method.comment: Set a String value in the preferences editor, to be written back once Commit() or Apply() are called.

method.name: PutFloat
method.comment: Set a float value in the preferences editor, to be written back once Commit() or Apply() are called.

method.name: SetOnPreferenceClickListener
method.comment: Sets an OnPreferenceClickListener for this Preference. The Preference will now raise the event: PreferenceClick(Tag As Object) As Boolean The event is raised after the user has clicked on the Preference but before android has handled the click. You must return a Boolean value when the event is raised. Return True to indicate that you have handled the click and android should take no further action, return False to indicate that you have not handled the click and android should now handle the click. Tag allows you to attach any object or value to this listener, it is not used by the listener it is simply passed back in the raised event.

method.name: SetOnPreferenceChangeListener
method.comment: Sets an OnPreferenceChangeListener for this Preference. The Preference will now raise the event: PreferenceChange(NewValue As Object, Tag As Object) As Boolean The event is raised after the user has changed the Preference but before the change is committed to SharedPreferences. You must return a Boolean value when the event is raised. Return True to allow the change to be committed, return False to prevent the change being committed. Tag allows you to attach any object or value to this listener, it is not used by the listener it is simply passed back in the raised event.
